title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: NA
text: section guides contribute direct external partner. Following guidelines helps maintainers community understand report üìù, reproduce behavior üíª üíª, find related reports üîé. Create issue . recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Provide much detail possible, starting beginning repo cloned following steps took help us recreate bug faced Provide specific examples demonstrate steps. Include links files GitHub projects, copy/pasteable snippets, use examples. Provide specifications environment bug found Include screenshots animated GIFs show following described steps clearly demonstrate problem. contributing directly: - Use issues listing tasks need accomplishment, assignment tasks. - Issues linked project milestones. - Project board used organize issues. - Pull beginning work session, push end. guidelines adapted Atom‚Äôs contrbuting guidleines UBC-DSCI‚Äôs provided example

title: grp1_project_package-vignette
text: goal grp1ProjectPackage provide functions data preprocessing exploratory data analyses. grp1ProjectPackage simplifies following tasks.: Loading data URL Removing certain columns data set Creating ggplot boxplot Splitting data training testing sets document introduces tools mentioned well examples apply data frames use different real-world scenarios.

what: 1. Load data from a URL using load_data()
title: grp1_project_package-vignette
text: Data often stored URLs internet. following shows example using load_data() function using URL. garments factory data set loaded URL 1197 rows 15 columns. details use function, check help(load_data).
code: #> Rows: 1197 Columns: 15 #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Column specification ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #> Delimiter: "," #> chr  (4): date, quarter, department, day #> dbl (11): team, targeted_productivity, smv, wip, over_time, incentive, idle_... #>  #> ‚Ñπ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ‚Ñπ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 15 #>   date     quarter  department day       team targeted_productivity   smv   wip #>   <chr>    <chr>    <chr>      <chr>    <dbl>                 <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 1/1/2015 Quarter1 sweing     Thursday     8                  0.8  26.2   1108 #> 2 1/1/2015 Quarter1 finishing  Thursday     1                  0.75  3.94    NA #> 3 1/1/2015 Quarter1 sweing     Thursday    11                  0.8  11.4    968 #> 4 1/1/2015 Quarter1 sweing     Thursday    12                  0.8  11.4    968 #> 5 1/1/2015 Quarter1 sweing     Thursday     6                  0.8  25.9   1170 #> 6 1/1/2015 Quarter1 sweing     Thursday     7                  0.8  25.9    984 #> # ‚Ñπ 7 more variables: over_time <dbl>, incentive <dbl>, idle_time <dbl>, #> #   idle_men <dbl>, no_of_style_change <dbl>, no_of_workers <dbl>, #> #   actual_productivity <dbl>

previous_headings: Demonstration of basic functions in grp1ProjectPackage
title: grp1_project_package-vignette
text: Frequently, dealing extensive data sets, may columns unnecessary unappealing. case, can use function clean_data() drop columns. details use function, check help(clean_data). dropping single column qsec mtcars can see , column qsec dropped data frame. dropping multiple columns mtcars Columns mpg, disp, qsec dropped. inappropriate column name inputted, error occur. instance, wrong column name mpf inputted instead mpg. function produce error. clean_data(data, "mpf") produce following message: ‚ÄúError clean_data(data,‚Äùmpf‚Äù) : column names incorrect. Please try ‚Äù
code: head(clean_data(data, "qsec")) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460  1  0    3    1 head(clean_data(data, c("mpg","disp","qsec"))) #>                   cyl  hp drat    wt vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4           6 110 3.90 2.620  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag       6 110 3.90 2.875  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710          4  93 3.85 2.320  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive      6 110 3.08 3.215  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout   8 175 3.15 3.440  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant             6 105 2.76 3.460  1  0    3    1

title: grp1_project_package-vignette
text: often necessary visual representations order comprehend data effectively. Visually displaying data helps simplify complex problems transforming data understandable format showing trends outliers. high-quality visualization tells narrative eliminating extraneous details highlighting crucial informatation. following function creates boxplot data given. details use function, check help(create_boxplot). boxplot created displaying MPG Number Cylinders.

what: 4. Splitting data into training and testing sets using train_test_split()
title: grp1_project_package-vignette
text: many model selection techniques splitting data training testing sets required. following function splits data training testing sets based given inputs. details use function, check help(create_boxplot). data set randomly split training set 75% entries testing set 25% data.

title: Data Loading, Cleaning, and Preprocessing
text: goal grp1ProjectPackage provide user package simplifying data pre-processing basic exploratory data analyses. includes functions loading data html, removing certain columns data set, creating boxplots, splitting data training testing sets.

title: Data Loading, Cleaning, and Preprocessing
text: can install development version grp1ProjectPackage GitHub :

title: Data Loading, Cleaning, and Preprocessing
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Load data URL using load_data() Dropping columns clean_data() purpose demonstration rest package, use basic data set called mtcars. Dropping column named mpg mtcars. can see , column mpg dropped data frame. Creating boxplot using create_boxplot()  Splitting data training testing sets using train_test_split()

data<-load_data("https://7e6cd356-86ad-4874-abc7-3a69bbbc39e6.filesusr.com/ugd/c5a545_c1b17c070c984dfcb14cf1c3bb0b6e67.csv?dn=garments_worker_productivity.csv") head(data) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 15 #>   date   quarter depar‚Ä¶¬π day    team targe‚Ä¶¬≤   smv   wip over_‚Ä¶¬≥ incen‚Ä¶‚Å¥ idle_‚Ä¶‚Åµ #>   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 1/1/2‚Ä¶ Quarte‚Ä¶ sweing  Thur‚Ä¶     8    0.8  26.2   1108    7080      98       0 #> 2 1/1/2‚Ä¶ Quarte‚Ä¶ finish‚Ä¶ Thur‚Ä¶     1    0.75  3.94    NA     960       0       0 #> 3 1/1/2‚Ä¶ Quarte‚Ä¶ sweing  Thur‚Ä¶    11    0.8  11.4    968    3660      50       0 #> 4 1/1/2‚Ä¶ Quarte‚Ä¶ sweing  Thur‚Ä¶    12    0.8  11.4    968    3660      50       0 #> 5 1/1/2‚Ä¶ Quarte‚Ä¶ sweing  Thur‚Ä¶     6    0.8  25.9   1170    1920      50       0 #> 6 1/1/2‚Ä¶ Quarte‚Ä¶ sweing  Thur‚Ä¶     7    0.8  25.9    984    6720      38       0 #> # ‚Ä¶ with 4 more variables: idle_men <dbl>, no_of_style_change <dbl>, #> #   no_of_workers <dbl>, actual_productivity <dbl>, and abbreviated variable #> #   names ¬π‚Äãdepartment, ¬≤‚Äãtargeted_productivity, ¬≥‚Äãover_time, ‚Å¥‚Äãincentive, #> #   ‚Åµ‚Äãidle_time head(mtcars) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7 vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4           6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag       6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710          4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  0    3    1 create_boxplot(mtcars, as.factor(mtcars$cyl), mtcars$mpg, "MPG by No. Cylinders", "No. Cylinders", "mpg") train_test_split(mtcars, 0.75, "mpg") #> [[1]] #>                     mpg cyl
